definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Frontispiece illustration on the page facing the title page of a book.
sentences.chinese: 卷首插圖和扉頁照面的頁上插圖。

sentences.english: If you don't put in an appearance, everyone will think you have left.
sentences.chinese: 你不來打照面兒，大家會以爲你已經走了。

sentences.english: In the mirror is not popular, people used copper water Kam head-to-head, so-called Kam.
sentences.chinese: 在銅鏡未流行前，人們用銅鑑盛水照面，故鏡又稱鑑。

sentences.english: To avoid a meeting he drew nearer to the pillars of the railway bridge.
sentences.chinese: 爲了避免打個照面，他緊靠鐵道陸橋的柱子那邊走。

sentences.english: One day while he was working as a lorry driver, he had a close encounter with death.
sentences.chinese: 做卡車司機的某一天，他跟死神打了個照面。

sentences.english: We face away from each other, simply two girls standing back to back.
sentences.chinese: 我們就是兩個背靠背站着的女孩，互不照面。

sentences.english: When you greet the interviewer, offer a copy of your resume.
sentences.chinese: 當你與面試者照面，提供一份你的履歷表。

sentences.english: In addition to the school to make a face to face encounter, their lives rarely intersect.
sentences.chinese: 除了在學校偶遇打個照面，他們的生活很少有交集。

sentences.english: Actually, I've never met her face to face.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，我從未與她打過照面。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes and met the stare of a bilious clock.
sentences.chinese: 他擡起雙眼，跟那座逼視着的掛鐘打了個照面。

definition: to meet violent death/to get killed
in the wink of an eye/in a flash
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
to hit with a piercing blow
to fit one into the other/to bring two things into contact
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
